Manx: O VAASE ! cre’n reill t’ayd er sheelnaue,
English: O, Death! What a rule you have over mankind,

Manx: Nagh vel sparail banglane ny fraue,
English: That spares not branch or root,

Manx: Gyn geill da aeg ny shenn ;
English: No heed for young or old;

Manx: Nagh leah t’ou cummey'n seihll caghlaa,
English: Do you not hold the changing world fast,

Manx: Nagh leah t’ou dooinney reesht chyndaa
English: Do you not soon return man again

Manx: Dy ve ny ooir as joan.
English: To be earth and dust.

Manx: Nagh faggys haink eh da nyn gree
English: Did he not come near to our heart
To consider separating from it,
To leave it in the earth :
What longing took a grip upon us
That fully woke our feelings
By looking at the soil.

Manx: Agh JEE t'er n’yannoo goll-rish hene
English: But GOD has made it like himself

Manx: Nagh daag yn annym ayns e feme,
English: Did he not leave the soul in need of him,
Therefore she returned to him

Manx: E feme va hoshiaght soilshit jee,
English: Her need was first explained to it

Manx: As eisht lesh boggey, graih, as shee,
English: And then with joy, love and peace

Manx: Nee e cree er ny caghlaa.
English: Her heart will be changed.

Manx: E Annym maynrey myr shoh va
English: Her happy soul like this was
Waiting for the eternal happiness
That is in the presence of GOD;

Manx: Eisht haink y chaghter ren livrey
English: Then the messenger came that delivered,

Manx: Hug lesh yn annym thie gys fea
English: Brought the soul home to rest
And Heavenly joy.

Manx: Cha vel nyn drimshey gyn treishteil
English: Our sadness is not without hope
Of meeting the happy soul again
A witness of the Trinity;

Manx: Coyrt gloyr as ooashley son dy bra
English: Bringing glory and praise for ever
To the ALMIGHTY that was, and is,
And will be ever after.

Manx: Tra ta mee gys yn Oaie chyndaa
English: When I am returning to the grave
And waiting long for a voice,
She does not give an answer,
Then (I’m) thinking about times that are gone

Manx: Agh nish t’ee follit veih my hooill,
English: But now she is hidden from my eye,
And now returned to the earth.

Manx: My chree ta lane dy foddeeaght
English: My heart that is full of longing
Nevertheless I will wait with patience
For a time that is yet to come;
When I will meet her anew,

Manx: Raad nagh vel baase agh beaynid bra
English: Where death is only an eternal immortality
And happy, and holy.
The happy Soul that used to be
camping in the house of clay

Manx: Cabbaney ayns y thie dy chray
English: Is now turned to dust;
She bends before the throne
Forever giving glory to the glorious God

Manx: Dy bragh cur gloyr da’n JEE gloyroil
English: In the happiness of a day without end.
